docs.lead_paragraph: Since the Reagan Administration instituted rules for the care of handicapped infants in hospital nurseries 19 months ago, Federal Government officials have investigated 49 cases across the country. In each case, the hospitals voluntarily turned over the baby's medical records. But four weeks ago, the University Hospital at Stony Brook, a state hospital on Long Island, refused to comply with the Government's demand for the records of an infant born with multiple birth defects and known publicly only as Baby Jane Doe. It was the first time the Government had been turned down by a hospital, Federal officials said.

headline.main: BROAD EFFECTS EXPECTED FROM CASE OF BABY DOE
